title: What makes a good LoL youtube video?

embed.description: If you Guys enjoy my content. Remember to hit that Like button and Subscribe for more. Please take the time to notify me in the comments as to why you may or may not have enjoyed this video. All your thoughts really do help me produce videos to the best of my ability.

body: Hey guys, I recently posted a new League of Legends video onto my Youtube account. I've asked friends for advice on my videos and they say they are good and i've done well with the content i recorded :) But i thought i'd try expand to the community of LoL, and gather all of your opinions. Any advice would be great, i really do aim to produce content that people will love and enjoy watching.

replies.body:
wow that was really good, earned a sub :p
if you keep going...
Thank you so much man :) Will definantly keep going, was lots of fun to record and edit. Glad you liked it

More dramatic editing when necessary makes it somewhat funnier, refer to UberDanger
Or to stay less indecent, learn from Kshaway :D

But I enjoyed ur vid :)
Thanks :) Yeah i felt like I lacked on the editing at some points.
What's the song when you got the Penta?

There is stuff here in the conversations I know people are gonna find funny. Personally, I didn't, but whatever, I'm not offended so far either so I can't criticise that. Its just not my taste. I know other people are gonna find some of it funny so you are doing that right though.
One thing I really think you need is background music. There is a bit of background noise coming from the mics too. Just having a bit of background music (plenty of royalty free stuff you can use out there) could improve the video dramatically, I think. It covers up some of the background noise too. I realise you have music at some parts, but it'd be better to have music all the time. You can always change the music for the penta parts and give it higher volume, without changing the effect you already have.

Yes i agree with you about the background music being needed. I noticed myself too and therefore I've already downloaded a bunch of things (Royalty free of course). But yes i understand that my content may not appeal to everyone, but it's almost impossible to make everyone happy with this sort of thing. Again, thank you very much for commenting and checking out my content.

> [{quoted}](name=villakilla117,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=PjH6q64y,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2015-01-30T13:20:00.125+0000)
>
> Yes i agree with you about the background music being needed. I noticed myself too and therefore I've already downloaded a bunch of things (Royalty free of course). But yes i understand that my content may not appeal to everyone, but it's almost impossible to make everyone happy with this sort of thing. Again, thank you very much for commenting and checking out my content.

I threw you a like anyway. Pretty good job playing Fizz though. May I ask what editing program you use though? I like how the text on the video is done.

It was all done on Sony Vegas 13, Ive been using it for years producing things for the fun of it. The text is by far the longest part to edit into the video, each word is an individual layer, therefore sizing and cropping can be a painful process.
